intro: Lophiolepis haussknechtii, commonly known as the Cape mountain heath, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its compact, shrub-like growth habit. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or white, arranged in clusters. It thrives in well-drained, acidic soils and is often found in rocky or coastal environments. Lophiolepis haussknechtii is adapted to withstand drought and is an important component of fynbos vegetation.
